title: Voltaire on Peter the Great and Newton

content.prompt: Voltaire’s discussion of Peter the Great’s acceptance of Newtonian physics is best understood as a critique of which of the following?

choices.label: The persistence of folk stories and oral traditions
The reliance of Renaissance thinkers on classical Greek and Roman texts
The Enlightenment belief in the rational order of the universe
The efforts of religious and secular authorities to suppress scientific development

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
